titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Matthew Jennett papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday April 12, 2019 at 03:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.physdesc: (13 boxes) + 1 broadside folder, 4 record album storage
did.abstract: The Matthew Jennett papers contain subject files, sound recordings, and other material documenting the life and work of Matthew Jennett as editor of Pharos Books. The subject files feature correspondence, writings, and printed ephemera relating to publication projects with Pharos Books. There are files for authors, publishers, and designers, including Bob Cato, Franz Douskey, Peter Ganick (of Potes & Poets Press), Leslie Lee, and Jonathan Williams (of the Jargon Society), Patrick Leigh Fermor, among others. Files also contain examples of fine printing by small presses such as the Ives Street Press. Sound recordings collected by Jennett consist of nineteen 78 speed albums containing radio broadcasts dating from the 1940s. There are programs from the National Broadcasting Company (NBC) and the Columbia Workshop, including "Emma Lazarus," from the "Eternal Light Series" held at the Jewish Theological Seminary in New York City, and "They Burned the Books," a radio drama written by Stephen Vincent Benét.

langmaterial.language: Chiefly in English; some materials in Greek.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Boxes 6-9, 17 (sound recordings): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Matthew Jennett Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Matthew Jennett Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was acquired through a series of gifts from Matthew Jennett. The original gift, consisting of subject files, was received in 2006 and cataloged as the Matthew Jennett Papers Relating to Pharos Books (YCAL MSS 231). Subsequent gifts of manuscript material received in 2007 and 2008, consisting of additional subject files, sound recordings, and other material, were added to the papers and the collection was renamed the Matthew Jennett Papers. Additional gifts were received in 2011 and 2012 and processed in 2019.

bioghist.head: Matthew Jennett
bioghist.p: Matthew Jennett, former editor of Pharos Books in New Haven, Connecticut, is Curator of Special Collections, Rare Books & Archives, The American College of Greece.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Matthew Jennett papers contain subject files, sound recordings, and other material documenting the life and work of Matthew Jennett as editor of Pharos Books. The subject files feature correspondence, writings, printed ephemera, such as broadside and keepsakes, and other material documenting publication projects with Pharos Books. There are files for authors, publishers, and designers, including Bob Cato, Franz Douskey, Peter Ganick, Leslie Lee, and Jonathan Williams,Patrick Leigh Fermor, among others. Sound recordings collected by Jennett consist of nineteen 78 speed albums containing radio broadcasts dating from the 1940s. There are programs from the National Broadcasting Company (NBC) and the Columbia Workshop, including "Emma Lazarus," from the "Eternal Light Series" held at the Jewish Theological Seminary in New York City, and "They Burned the Books," a radio drama written by Stephen Vincent Benet.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Subject Files, 1883-2000. II. Sound Recordings, 1940-1949. III. Other Material, undated. IV. February 2011 Acquisition, 1925-2010. V. May 2012 Acquisition, 1980-2011.

Acquisitions recieved after the initial gift date were organized by accession. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition may overlap with/or relate to material found in other acquisitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Subject Files, features correspondence, writings, printed ephemera, and other material documenting publication projects with Pharos Books. There are files for authors, small presses, publishers, and designers, including Bob Cato, Franz Douskey, Peter Ganick, Leslie Lee, and Jonathan Williams, among others.

Folders have been preserved in their alphabetical arrangment by personal name. This means that files associated with small presses or publishers are arranged by the individual's last name. Hence, material relating to Potes & Poets Press can be found with Ganick, Peter, and files relating to the Jargon Society can be found with Williams, Jonathan. Cross references are provided where appropriate in the box and folder list below.

Many files contain mixed contents, with letters, drafts and proofs, financial records, and other material. Writings, when present, are identified in folder notes. Files also contain examples of modern fine printing by small presses such as Ives Street Press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Sound Recordings, consists of nineteen 78 speed albums containing radio broadcasts dating from the 1940s. There are programs from the National Broadcasting Company (NBC) and the Columbia Workshop, including "Emma Lazarus," from the "Eternal Light Series" held at the Jewish Theological Seminary in New York City, and "They Burned the Books," a radio drama written by Stephen Vincent Benet.
Albums are restricted pending reformatting and may be consulted only with persmission of the appropriate curator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 2011 addition to the collection includes Jennett's subject files, correspondence, photographs, clippings, collected materials and writings by Jennett as well as others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material has been arranged primarily in the order in which it was received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 2012 addition to the collection includes material relating to British author, Patrick Leigh Fermor. Material includes Jennett's correspondence with Fermor, writings by Fermor, and photographs of Fermor taken by Jennett.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material has been arranged primarily in the order in which it was received.
